headline: U.S. Plans to Trim Flight Roster of Service Animals
abstract: The Department of Transportation is proposing new rules that would  make it harder to fly with an emotional support animal.
lead_paragraph: The Department of Transportation is proposing an overhaul to the regulations around service animals on flights in the United States, banning all animals except dogs, and no longer forcing airlines to let animals accompany passengers who say they need them just for emotional support, officials said on Wednesday.
